answerText: taste receptors[10] Nervous input for two-thirds of the taste receptors of the tongue makes it through this cranial nerve, which is dysfunctional in Bell's palsy
heading: PADAWAN |2014 | 12 | 4 | Science | Biology | College
subject: Science
question: Question: In 2010, researchers at the University of Maryland discovered a subtype of these receptors in the lungs, which has interesting implications for treating asthma or COPD. [10] Name these receptors, which are highly concentrated atop the fungiform, foliate, and circumvallate papillae, and are grouped into namesake "buds." They are broadly divided into "bitter" and "sweet" families.
